Author: cabalamat
Content:
No such explanation is needed; in the lack of powerful motivating forces for education (or anything else) to be good, it will be mediocre. PG makes the point that school is bad, not because it was deliberately designed to be, but because the design spec was to warehouse otherwise potentially disruptive young people, not particularly to educate them: http://www.paulgraham.com/nerds.html

"""And as for the schools, they were just holding pens within this fake world. Officially the purpose of schools is to teach kids. In fact their primary purpose is to keep kids locked up in one place for a big chunk of the day so adults can get things done. And I have no problem with this: in a specialized industrial society, it would be a disaster to have kids running around loose."""

Author: redthehat
Content:
Thanks for the comment, I assume that by not using proper English, you may be referring to a few typos on site. I may have never got the best grades in English when I was in high school, however, as the site is still going through a lot of improvements, believe me, the spelling errors will be worked on.

I (the owner) do speak fluent English, it is my native tongue, so I do apologize if, for some reason, through the cultural boundaries that we may have, if the native English language that I have spoken since birth, differs from your idea of 'the English language'. I may very well look at an additional plug in with the new script that we will be migrating to within the next few months, that allows many other languages, including other adaptations of the English language, including 'Bad Spelling English', 'Deep South English', 'Tasmanian English', and even 'Pirate English'. I hope that this plug in will eliminate any offense that others may have with my bad use of the English language, and will (as you put it), do the world a massive favor. In the meantime, I will have somebody look over my apparent bad use of the english language, which out of 20k views, 100+ members, and many uploads, I have only ever had one complaint.What a shame it was about my use of the English vocabulary.I will endeavour to make sure that the english used on site, is as easy as possible for all who speak this fine language to understand, regardless of where you are from, or what your idea of the English language is.

By Adds, we mean that we advertise on the site. (another typo, I apologize). A lot of people dislike advertising on sites, especially those in the crowd who have been testing this site for a month in beta, and approaching two weeks completed.

Thanks for checking out the site though, its much appreciated, I am extremely apologetic about my 'bad' use of the English language, and am also glad that you support my policy against Cyber Bullying. Because lets face it, cyber bullying is like OMG, rlly ttly like OMGZLOLZ! INORITE, its like totally so wrng, I totally kwym! So wrng to pwn ppl with cyber pics. :p

Author: reedlaw
Content:
I agree that that blurb is a piece of poorly-written rhetoric, but the book is full of damning primary-source material that effectively support the author's points. If you want something less controversial perhaps, look at John Taylor Gatto's The Underground History of American Education. It is also available in its entirety online, but to spare you the huge download, I will link to reviews from hacker-friendly sites:\nhttp://www.kuro5hin.org/story/2004/7/27/215225/986\nhttp://books.slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=04/09/06/1722203...

I don't see what's wrong with a conspiracy theory. History is full of conspiracies and any deep study on human nature will point out to you the tendency of humans to conspire.

Author: fauigerzigerk
Content:
It would be consistent if everyone who was fit to inherit actually did inherit. But that is not the case. Some of those who are fit do not inherit and others do. What is the basis for this inequality? Birth.

She destroys the idea of meritocracy that she herself presented so eloquently and discredits libertarianism as yet another excuse for those born wealthy to keep their wealth.

If an hair is not equal to his money it destroys him? Come on, what does it even mean to be "equal to money"? And how can someone who does not inherit wealth even prove that he or she is "equal to the money"? That's just the kind of fluffy nonsense that moral philosophers are so infamous for.

Author: aerique
Content:
No, he wasn't just that. Your comment says more about you than about Bill Hicks.

Bill Hicks has been quoted by more than one famous comedian as an example and inspiration. Among his repertoire was toilet humour, yes, but he also was a razor-sharp critic of society, beliefs, values. He wasn't just a comedian, he also tried to make people think.

Author: njharman
Content:
> Most people don't even know what the different is between a web app and an iphone app

Exactly! That is the problem. They don't know your web app is an iphone app. So, they get annoyed when it doesn't have all the functionality of an iphone app. They have higher bar of expectation that a webapp inherently can not reach.

If it was obviously a "web page" then user expectations are much lower and they are likely to be impressed by what it can do.

The key to success is not being good. It's being better than expected.

Content:
They only donate if you upgrade from IE6 to IE8 (or so said the site). People who are still using IE6 probably don't even know what's Firefox or Chrome (I know plenty of people that fits in here).

I don't think it's about the marketshare, they are targetting their own users. It's probably more about getting rid of the dinosaur that is IE6 and moving forward (about time).
